intro: Cyclobalanus leptogyne, commonly known as the slender-fruited cyclobalan, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cyclobalanus leptogyne is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
